results.title: Once upon a time in China III
results.creator_credit: Golden Harvest, Film Workshop, Tsui Hark and Ng See Yuen
results.brief_description: The third adventure sees martial arts champion Jet Lee journey to Beijing to visit his father who runs a medicine factory. He arrives on the eve of the Lion Dance martial arts festival where rival factions are stirring up trouble. Once he enters the contest, things really heat up and non-stop action and amazing feats of strength and skill are the result. In Cantonese with English and Chinese subtitles.

results.title: Once upon a time in America (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Embassy International Pictures, Arnon Milchan and Sergio Leone
results.brief_description: Crime, passion and a lust for power - an explosive saga of gangland America. Its extraordinary craftsmanship, together with its exceptional levels of acting and storytelling, place it among such other R-rated classics as “The Deerhunter”, “The Godfather”, “Midnight Express” and “A Clockwork Orange”. Stars Robert De Niro, James Woods and Elizabeth McGovern.

results.title: Once upon a forest [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Hanna-Barbera Productions, Zotic Fox, HTV Cymbu Wales, David Kirschner, Jerry Mills and Charles Grosvenor
results.brief_description: Dapplewood is a magical place. One day three Furling friends, Abagail the wood mouse, Edgar the mole and Russell the hedgehog find their lives seriously disrupted. A chemical spill threatens Dapplewood and their young friend Michelle becomes seriously ill from the toxic fumes. The three friends use the skills they learned from their teacher Cornelius and embark on an exciting journey to find help for their friend. From the famous Hanna-Barbera studios.

results.title: On the Town
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, United Artists Corporation, Arthur Freed, Gene Kelly and Stanley Donen
results.brief_description: A great musical comedy which is given full treatment with fine singing and dancing. It is the story of three sailors and their girls. Starring Gene Kelly, Ann Miller and Frank Sinatra.

results.title: On the Bowery
results.brief_description: This award-winning documentary tells about life in New York’s Bowery, the haunt of alcoholics and derelicts. No attempt is made to sensationalise; it is simply an objective, but at the same time stark and moving, account of men who have passed the point of no return and live in a half-world of cheap drink, argument, theft, card-playing and bread and soup from the local mission.

results.title: On golden pond
results.creator_credit: ITC Films, Bruce Gilbert and Mark Rydell
results.brief_description: Cranky 80-year-old retired professor Norman Thayer makes his annual pilgrimage with his wife, Ethel, to their New England summer lake-side home. Their solitude is interrupted, however, when their daughter, Chelsea, arrives with her new fiancee and his son, Billy, in tow. The three generations collide, but after persuading Norman and Ethel to mind Billy, Chelsea and fiancee leave for a romantic European holiday. What begins as a stubborn battle of wills between Norman and Billy, slowly turns into the relationship Norman never had with his own daughter. However, it is through this warm and accepting relationship with Billy that both Norman and Chelsea are finally able to display affection towards one another. Cast includes Katharine Hepburn, Henry Fonda, Jane Fonda, Doug McKeon and Dabney Coleman.

results.title: Oliver [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Columbia, Warwick, Romulus Films, John Wolf and Carol Reed
results.brief_description: Perhaps the best loved of all family pictures, “Oliver” is a joyous and entertaining version of Dickens’ “Oliver Twist”. Mark Lester plays Oliver, the foundling who escapes the indignities of the workhouse to find success and happiness in the London underworld. Oliver’s new friends include the Artful Dodger and Fagin who teach him to “pick a pocket”. Star roles are played by Harry Secombe, Oliver Reed and Shani Wallis.

results.title: Office killer
results.creator_credit: Artfear Productions, Christine Vachon, Pamela Koffler and Cindy Sherman
results.brief_description: Usually known for her extensive career in photography spanning over 20 years, Cindy Sherman directs her first feature film and brings to life the characters that she has depicted within her photography. Dorine (Kane) is the company doormat, seemingly obliging and mild mannered until one day she accidentally electrocutes a fellow worker, who happens to be her most obnoxious opponent. The unhinged Dorine continues her killing spree believing that all can be friends when dead. Her antics verge on discovery when the bitchy co-worker played by Molly Ringwald suspects that all is not okay. Following in the b-grade genre of film-making, Sherman delights with an excess of gory special effects. Cast also includes: Jeanne Tripplehorn.
